title: Drawing, "Wall Elevation of Bedroom Alcove", ca. 1780
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite on white laid paper
provenance: Collection of Leon Decloux (acquired by him after 1906)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Elevation of a section of a painted wall showing an alcove at center hung with tasseled draperies above a day bed with blue pillows. Predominate color scheme is white, blue and gold. Trophies on side walls include quivers, arrows, swords, ribbons and doves, possibly indicating a theme of love.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Wall Elevation of Bedroom Alcove", ca. 1780.
ca. 1780. Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-263.
